title: So apparently this behaviour is allowed... :/
body:
Great game, letting people say these things and then the report system never working...
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body: Because that makes it all better, even though riot themselves say that the mute function existing isn't a reason that you can be toxic.

Yeah that's the community, and hell isn't even that bad all things considered.

But the Volunteers on here won't hear a word of it because they don't see it in their games apparently.

oh you never know, maybe the sylas was trying to compliment them, you can't just assume they're toxic, they might have a history of good behaviour, and this is just part of continueing that history of being a completely posative part of the community, that is completely wholesome and improves and enriches the league experience.

(I am being sarcastic if that wasn't completely obvious, except maybe for the last bit about enriching the league experience, because imo this is exactly what the 'league experience' is nowadays).

You rarely get feedback from reports. There is one notification, but it's very limited, and not seeing it doesn't mean no-one was punished.

It can be frustrating, but with an emphasis on reform, and on preventing things like witch-hunting, Riot has to keep things pretty private.

A lack of clear feedback doesn't mean the system does nothing, and one report is all it takes to get a game reviewed. If you feel a report wasn't adequately addressed, or for whatever reason couldn't use post-game reporting, you can submit a ticket via player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Two important notes: Support cannot and will not tell you *anything* about another player's account, implicit or otherwise, so you will get a generic "thanks for the report" type response, and manual reviews are much slower than automatic ones, so you should always use post-game reporting where possible.

Support cannot tell you anything about the account? 

True, though I do recall a few seasons back, you would get a notification if a player you reported got punished.

Manual reviews take a long time? 

True, they probably haven't even gotten around to starting.

Someone was punished?

Sorta True, whilst I've yet to see a ban recently (in the ol' days, Riot seemed a bit more open to banning inexcusable behavior), I'm sure some of them got chat restricted for 10 games or so, but I'm not sure this is really going to make them reform.

Sorry you experienced this, I can assure you there is some good in the community too. I'd be very surprised if he wasn't banned via this post, so good work for bringing it here.

But on another note, don't let a neg WR 2000 game bronze 4 get to you, he's a pathetic player and most certainly pathetic human being.
